track.name: UX & Web Design: How AI UX Tools are Revolutionizing Design and Accessibility
Agile Product Development: Efficient Collaboration, Project Control, and Automation
Digital Marketing & SEO: The Revolution in Content Discovery and Search
Web Development: The future Role of the Website and how Automation changes Production
Generative AI & Automation: AI Content Flood - Keeping Design and Marketing creative and unique

speaker.details: Nina Bordet ist Mitgründerin der Firma mindberry Consulting, die seit fünfzehn Jahren weltweit Unternehmen von Start-ups bis Fortune-500-Unternehmen in Sachen Websiteoptimierung und Online-User-Research berät. Nina beschäftigt sich am liebsten damit, Websites und Entscheidungsabläufe von Besuchern zu optimieren. Nach fast zehn Jahren bei Procter & Gamble und eBay hilft sie heute ihren Kunden, anhand einer eigens entwickelten Methode herauszufinden, was in den Köpfen von Websitebesuchern vorgeht und wie man die User Experience und Conversion Rates mit diesem Wissen verbessern kann.

Sebastian begleitet die IT-Industrie bereits seit mehr als zwei Jahrzehnten; als Redakteur, als Beobachter, als Zuhörer. Er verantwortet bei Software & Support Media den Bereich Content und leitet die Teams, die redaktionell für Magazine und Konferenzen auf der Plattform entwickler.de bzw. devm.io verantwortlich sind .

As a Lead Product Designer at SumUp, I am passionate about crafting intuitive experiences grounded in user research, data analysis, and Lean UX principles. My focus lies in strategic planning, rapid prototyping, and early user testing, all while fostering collaboration across different teams. Since mid-2023, I have been exploring Growth Design, where I appreciate the structured, data-driven approach to maximizing business impact.

As the Head of SecOps for the largest greenfield technology transformation project in Europe, Lianne is building a leading edge security team from scratch to meet the needs of a modern retail organisation while empowering her team to think innovatively to create new standards in best practices. Drawing upon her expertise as a cyber-anthropologist (through her consultancy, The Anthrosecurist), her practical experience as a security-focused software developer and as a security practitioner; Lianne combines the human and the technical aspects of security to evangelise a cultural security transformation. In 2023 she won ‘Cyber Personality of the Year’ in The Real Cyber Awards. You can listen to Lianne talk about her human-centric approach every Thursday on her award-winning technology podcast Compromising Positions, in which she interviews non-cybersecurity people from the world of anthropology, psychology and behavioural science about cybersecurity culture. She is doing a Masters in AI and Data Science in 2024.

Henning Fries ist Senior User Interface Architect und beschäftigt sich mit Themen wie Ideation, Accessibility, UX und UI. Mit mehr als fünfzehn Jahren Berufserfahrung arbeitet er als Berater, Trainer, Entwickler, Project Manager und als (Web-)Designer in Deutschland und Luxemburg.

When not working on clubzero.co, smartmessages.net, supporting 1CRM at syniah.com, writing & pentesting for Radically Open Security, or acting as a DPO, I'm the maintainer of PHPMailer, the second-most forked PHP project on GitHub, and probably the world's most popular email sending code. I'm a contributor to many other open-source projects, I write songs about open-source, and I wrote the HTML5 email address spec. I'm an accomplished PHP coder, Linux sysadmin, technical writer, and MySQL DBA. I'm a strong advocate of digital rights and privacy – I love GDPR! I've been speaking at technical conferences around the world since 2006. I live in the French alps with my wife, kids, cat, guitars, bikes, and far too many skis.

Der bekannte Webtechnologieexperte und Buchautor Peter Kröner forscht über die Webstandards von Morgen. Was er über HTML5, CSS3 und neue JavaScript-Standards herausfindet, schreibt er in Bücher und Blogposts oder vermittelt es in Seminaren, Workshops und Vorträgen im ganzen Land weiter. Zuvor war er als selbstständiger Webdesigner und Frontend-Entwickler tätig.

Astrid Kramer is an expert in Corporate SEO since 2007. The combination of SEO with UX and business requirements has brought her international key accounts. She excels in public speaking and moderating in front of hundreds of audience members.

Brecht De Ruyte is a self-taught front-end developer located in Belgium with a passion for UX and Design. During the day you can find him working at iO, a full service agency. Besides that, he is also a Google Developer Expert, Smashing Magazine writer and blog owner of utlitybend.com. He also participates in the W3C communities: Open UI, CSS-next, and WHATNOT

After studying media and political science, Hannes completed a master's degree in media psychology, where he expanded his interest in human behaviour and technology. This led him to the field of user experience. Previously, Hannes worked at YOUSE GmbH in Berlin in the field of UX research and UX consulting. He shared his professional experience in human-centred design as a digital speaker at the Usability Day Berlin 2020 and 2021. Hannes has been part of the UX team at Appmatics since 2024 and works on various projects in the website and app sector to improve the usability and UX of digital products.

Bohuslav Šimek arbeitet als leitender Programmierer bei IntraWorlds, wo er hauptsächlich für die zugrunde liegende Architektur verantwortlich ist. In seiner Freizeit versucht er, das Atwood-Gesetz auf PHP anzuwenden. Dieses fruchtlose Unterfangen lässt sich mit den folgenden Worten zusammenfassen: „Jede Anwendung, die in PHP geschrieben werden kann, wird letztendlich in PHP geschrieben werden.“

Paid Digital Marketing ist die berufliche Heimat von Lara Marie Massmann. Seit 2013 ist sie bereits im Agentur-Umfeld tätig und verfügt daher über ein umfangreiches Know-how in den Bereichen Suchmaschinenmarketing (SEA/PPC), Social Media Advertising (SMA), Marktplatzwerbung (MPA) und Google Shopping Optimierung. Nach ihrer Tätigkeit als SEA Consultant bei Performics hat Lara die letzten Jahre bei der Berliner Search-, Performance- und Content-Marketing-Agentur Claneo verbracht und berät nun bei AdStrive zahlreiche Kunden aus den unterschiedlichsten Branchen. Darüber hinaus gibt sie ihr Wissen und ihre Erkenntnisse gerne als Referentin auf zahlreichen nationalen und internationalen Konferenzen weiter.

Felix van de Sand ist Mitgründer und Geschäftsführer der Münchner UX-/UI-Design- und Softwareentwicklungs-Agentur COBE. Hier ist er federführend dafür verantwortlich, die User Experience digitaler Produkte von den Werten einer Marke abzuleiten. In diesem Zuge hat er die hauseigene User-Experience-Identity-(UXi-)Methode entwickelt, die Erkenntnisse aus den Neurowissenschaften und der Verhaltensökonomie auf das Gebiet des User Experience Designs anwendet. Die wissenschaftlichen Grundlagen und die Praxis-Anwendung der Methode sind Thema seiner Fachbücher „User Experience Identity – Mit Neuropsychologie digitale Produkte zu Markenbotschaftern machen” und “User Experience Is Brand Experience: The Psychology Behind Successful Digital Products and Services”, beide erschienen im Springer Verlag. Vor seinem Start in die digitale Welt war Felix mehrere Jahre als Designstratege bei designaffairs tätig, einer der größten Designagenturen Europas. Den Grundstein für seine berufliche Laufbahn legte er mit einem Produktdesign Studium an der Bauhaus-Universität Weimar.

Maxim Salnikov is an Oslo-based cloud and web front-end geek with a great passion for building a developer community. He has been designing and developing complex web applications since the end of the last century and has extensive experience with all aspects of the web platform with a focus on apps that manage real-time data from IoT devices and Progressive Web Apps. He is a Google Developer Expert in Web Technologies & IoT and a former Microsoft MVP in Development Technologies. Maxim is a founder and active contributor to two conferences. He also runs Norway's largest meetups dedicated to web frontend and mobile. Maxim Salnikov is a tech and cloud community enthusiast based in Oslo. With over two decades of experience as a web developer, he shares his extensive knowledge of the web platform, cloud computing, and AI by speaking at and providing training for developer events worldwide.

Vincent Schlothauer is a senior UX designer with experience in both business-to-customer and business-to-employee design. He is a proponent of UX at every level of the agile software development cycle and hopes to spread the gospel of user centricity everywhere he goes. Having both taught design thinking classes at REWE digital and helped establish a design system for business-to-employee applications, Vincent is passionate about user research, accessibility and the day-to-day geekiness of prototyping.

Over 15 years ago, Daniel Yuschick began his career as a designer, before moving full time into frontend development. He's since taken that experience, along with a passion for accessibility, and found a home in the world of design systems working most recently as a Lead Design Systems Developer for various companies. Daniel is an accessibility advocate, author and mentor at the Helsinki chapter of Codebar and Hive Helsinki coding school. He is most passionate about great chocolate, beautiful tattoos and bridging the gap between design and development to create accessible and resilient design systems.

Ashnita ist eine Front-End-Webentwicklerin, die Angular und TypeScript liebt. Ihre Leidenschaft ist das Lernen und Teilen von Wissen. Sie schreibt für Telerik Blogs, ist Women Techmakers Ambassador und Organisatorin der freeCodeCamp-Reading-Studiengruppe.

Derick Rethans ist ein Experte für PHP-Interna und Autor von 'https://xdebug.org'. Er arbeitet als unabhängiger Auftragnehmer und Berater an PHP-Erweiterungen und verwandten Projekten. Er arbeitet für die PHP Foundation an der Verbesserung von PHP und trägt weiterhin in zahlreichen Formen zum PHP-Projekt bei ('https://www.php.net/datetime', 'https://xdebug.org', PHP 4.4/7.4 Release Manager, etc). Er hält häufig Vorträge auf Konferenzen, ist der Autor von 'https://phpdatebook.com', php|architect's Guide to Date and Time Programming, und der Mitautor von 'PHP 5 Power Programming'. Derick ist außerdem Gastgeber des wöchentlich erscheinenden PHP Internals News Podcasts.

Norman Bielig runs the creative studio desire lines, which focuses on the bicycle and mobility industry. They are driven by the desire to get people moving, which is why the topic of accessibility plays a role in various contexts. Internally, he is responsible for the Strategy & Consulting segment.
Frank Puscher ist seit 30 Jahren kritischer Beobachter der Digitalszene. Er liebt Technologie und hasst den Overhype und inhaltsleeres Markting-Blabla.

Martin Andree is a professor of media sciences at the University of Cologne. He has done more than 15 years of research on the dominance of big tech including the first holistic measurement of digital media concentration based on real usage measurements („Atlas of the Digital World“). He has published 7 books, among others the bestseller „Big Tech must go!“ that sparked a huge debate about digital dominance in Germany — including about one hundred events, interviews on television and radio programs and in newspapers, press contributions, conference talks, panels and reviews. The book was just published in English translation (www.bigtechmustgo.com) and received the „Günter Wallraff Special Award of Press Freedom and Human Rights“. Martin Andree is supporting political stakeholders as well as media authorities in Germany and Europe with his expertise. He is also alumni of Cambridge University, University of Münster and Harvard Business School.

Gesa Lischka is an internationally renowned neuromarketing expert with over 20 years of experience in the advertising industry. A graduate of studies in England, she serves as a consultant for top 100 companies both in Germany and internationally, crafting strategies for corporate and brand management rooted in neuroscientific and behavioral psychological principles. As the owner of a successful marketing agency with over 70 employees, she seamlessly blends her expertise in the field with a powerful stage presence. Gesa captivates audiences as a television expert and speaker at prestigious events, including TED Talks and global neuromarketing and marketing conferences. Her dynamic and entertaining presentations have earned her multiple international speaker awards, further cementing her reputation as a leading figure in the field.

Friedrich Tromm is the founder and managing director of TryNoAgency. Together with his team, the advertising expert works with not only startups but also large corporations. The motto is "Understanding means selling." TryNoAgency (Part of Grow) supports brands such as N26, Foodspring, HP, Heycar, and Strato.

Laura Marwede is Head of UX & Strategy at TEAM23 in Augsburg and an experienced expert in UX leadership. With a background as a trained Diplomat and a Master's degree in Northern European Studies, she brings diverse perspectives to her work. Her key areas of focus include UX strategy, agile project management, and the development of user-centred digital products. As a certified Scrum Master and UXQB® Professional, she combines agile expertise with a deep understanding of user needs and strategic objectives. Laura has successfully led numerous teams and facilitated workshops on agile product development and UX strategies. In addition to her role as a speaker and lecturer, she actively contributes to the German UPA, sharing her practical insights with the professional community. Her talks offer practical insights into UX leadership strategies and agile methodologies, helping organisations implement user-centred innovations effectively.

Sven Wolfermann ist freier Webentwickler mit Schwerpunkt Frontend-Entwicklung und lebt südlich von Berlin. Seit 2005 ist er mit seiner Firma maddesigns tätig. Sven ist seit 2009 zertifizierter TYPO3-Integrator und beschäftigt sich seit zwei Jahren intensiv mit dem Thema CSS3. Zudem beschäftigt er sich mit aktuellen Themen wie Sass und Responsive Design.

Sebastian Zarzutzki hat sich in den letzten fünf Jahren bei der Digitalagentur Digitas als erfolgreicher Spezialist für Suchmaschinenoptimierung etabliert. Als Senior SEO Consultant berät er mit einem Team von 15 Fachleuten namhafte internationale Marken. Seine umfassende Expertise erstreckt sich über klassische Optimierungsmaßnahmen hinaus und umfasst technisches SEO, innovative Analyse- und Monitoring-Strategien sowie die Integration von Datenanalyse und Künstlicher Intelligenz in die SEO-Prozesse.

Florian Lenz creates transformative change at the intersection of creativity, strategy, and user-centricity. With a Master’s in Communication & Product Design and long standing experience in strategic consulting, he empowers organizations to kick-start transformative processes and uncover innovative solutions. As a Creative Lead and seasoned workshop facilitator at Taikonauten, a Berlin-based digital agency for user centered products and services, he guides teams through uncertainties while aligning strategic goals with agile execution. His deep expertise in developing user-centric products ensures every solution is crafted with empathy and precision.

Norman Wagner, co-founder and board member of Initiative 18, demonstrates how we can strategically free ourselves from this one-sided control – through alternative technologies, fair market conditions, and a values-based allocation of advertising investments. Because without an independent infrastructure, our media landscape remains vulnerable to blackmail – with potentially dramatic consequences for democracy.

Tobias Hagenau, co-founder and CEO of awork, is an engineer with nearly 15 years of experience in developing digital tools to make work better for teams. Tobias firmly believes that improving our work and how we approach it can significantly improve our lives. He aims to establish awork as a role model for other teams, demonstrating how to create a better future of work together.

Nina Jameson is a computer scientist, digital accessibility expert, and co-founder of Gehirngerecht Digital GmbH. With over 13 years of experience in software development, she has guided both small and large companies in understanding accessibility requirements and establishing effective processes. Nina’s hands-on approach not only makes websites and applications more inclusive but also helps teams cultivate a deeper understanding of why inclusion truly matters. Through Gehirngerecht Digital, she brings a fresh, engaging perspective to accessibility—ensuring it becomes a natural part of every digital solution.

Jan Persiel is a Hamburg-based Art Director and UI Engineer with over two decades of experience in digital design. Since founding his own design studio in 2001, he has built and led design teams, creating exceptional user experiences through well-structured design systems and operations for national and international corporations and projects. In all his projects he strives for a strong collaboration between design and engineering to achieve the best possible results in a competitive time budget. Beyond his design practice, Jan shares his expertise as a UX/UI trainer at Digitale Leute School and in aid projects. He is also passionate about cocktails and mocktails, developing low-alcohol spirits and crafting new flavours.

Andy Abel ist seit Januar 2021 Leiter Digital bei der Audiotainment Südwest GmbH & Co. KG, wo er die digitalen Strategien für bekannte Radiosender wie RPR1., Radio Regenbogen und bigFM verantwortet. Zuvor war er als Leiter Digital Business in der RPR Unternehmensgruppe tätig und steuerte die digitalen Innovations- und Umsatzentwicklungen. Andy hat umfangreiche Erfahrung in der Leitung von digitalen Entwicklungen und der strategischen Ausrichtung von Social Media, Online-Aktivitäten sowie der Erstellung neuer Content-Plattformen. Als Dozent an der CBS International Business School und der IHK gibt er sein Wissen in den Bereichen Digital Management, Blockchain und Digital Marketing weiter. Zuvor war er in verschiedenen Marketing-Positionen tätig, darunter als Leiter Marketing bei bigFM, wo er die Marktführerschaft in der Social Media-Radio-Community ausbaute und zahlreiche Eventmarketing-Aktionen verantwortete. Jan ist passionierter Mentor und Experte für digitale Transformation.

Marianna Paszkowska is the founder of Font Mavens, a font development studio based in Thessaloniki, Greece. She supports clients with type design, font engineering, and management of complex font development projects. Her work often centers on variable fonts, including those with large design spaces and multiscript character sets. Marianna is especially interested in the evolution of font technologies and brings a thoughtful, systems-oriented approach to making type work better—for designers, developers, and users alike. When she’s not wrangling Bézier curves or navigating font production workflows, she enjoys exploring textile arts, traditional crafts, and gardening. She’s also drawn to mindfulness practices that invite presence and slowness—small antidotes to the demands and pace of digital work.

As an expert in the fields of Generative AI, Voice User Interfaces, Conversation Design, and Behavioral Design, Yvo Richner has an exciting profile and his knowledge strikes a chord with our times. He has extensive expertise in the conception, prototyping/operationalization, and optimization of AI voice assistants. Yvo Richner has more than 15 years of international experience in logistics, retail, and manufacturing/production. He is also a certified Voice Consultant and holds a Master of Science in Business & Economics.

Fili is a technical SEO consultant, ex-Google engineer, frequent conference speaker and was a senior technical lead in the Google Search Quality team. At Search Brothers he offers SEO consulting services with SEO audits, SEO training and successfully recovers websites from Google penalties.

Dr. Philipp Spreer is the author of the foundational work "PsyConversion" and initiator of elaboratum's Behavioral Design Unit. The team has already proven the effectiveness of the PsyConversion® method in more than 300 hundred client projects and has developed award-winning digital dialogues and funnels. Philipp received his doctorate in Göttingen at the intersection of marketing and psychology and has been researching customer behavior in digital business for more than a decade. His work has paved the way for innovative product formats and particularly effective digital interfaces.

Lennard Schmidt, 27, is the CEO and co-founder of Langdock, a leading provider of artificial intelligence solutions for businesses. Langdock secured $3 million in seed funding from notable investors like Y Combinator and General Catalyst, quickly establishing itself in the market. The startup's platform allows companies of all sizes to securely provide AI to their employees while leveraging internal data. Today, Langdock serves over 500 corporate clients, including prominent names like Der Spiegel, Merck, and GetYourGuide, with more than 40,000 active users.

Christian Klöckner is Co-Chair of the EBU TV Platforms group. He works at WDR on innovations relating to video and TV platforms. These include projects such as the 360/WebXR extension of the ARD player, the mouse app for smart TVs with HbbTV, the piloting of DVB-I and automated live subtitling for WDR Lokalzeit. Christian is Co-Chair of the EBU TV Platforms group.

Jonas Lembeck studied Media Economics at the Munich Film School and Business Administration at the prestigious LMU (University of Munich). His graduation project at the film school earned an Oscar® recognition. In 2020, he co-founded lehof, a strategic marketing consultancy, where he leads client strategy. Notable clients include Paulaner, Chiemseer, HUAWEI, BMW, and Dr. Hauschka. Additionally, he serves as a guest lecturer at the University of Erlangen.

Philip Hofmann holds a diploma in Film Production and Media Economics from the prestigious Munich Film School. His graduation project was awarded an Oscar®. In 2020, he co-founded lehof, a strategic marketing consultancy, where he serves as Managing Partner for Creativity. His clients include Paulaner, Chiemseer, HUAWEI, BMW, and Dr. Hauschka. Additionally, he is a guest lecturer at the University of Erlangen.

Abhay Kapur is a Product Manager at BarrierBreak, a leading digital accessibility testing and consulting firm based in Mumbai, India. His focus lies on building products that simplify accessibility testing and management of digital assets. He is passionate about creating inclusive digital solutions and strongly advocates for the integration of accessibility from the very beginning of the product lifecycle.

Yannik Markworth is co-founder of Klein aber, a leading YouTube agency that helps brands think and act like creators. With a background in storytelling, data-driven strategy, and platform-native content, he specializes in turning corporate goals into creator-first formats that resonate with real audiences. As a speaker, he shares insights on how brands can build relevance, reach, and revenue by embracing the mindset and methods of modern creators.

Tim Kawohl is Head of UX/UI at COBE. There, he crafts user experiences and impactful design strategies, always with an eye on the balance of innovation, results and efficient processes. He collaborates with global leaders like BMW, Eventim, Vodafone and many more to design brand driven User Experience Identities, creat elaborate but adaptable Design Systems and set up goal-oriented Design Operations.

Taranee Hellbeck is a Project and Event Manager for the DACH region at Berlitz Germany GmbH, responsible for the strategic planning and execution of B2B events with a focus on knowledge transfer and brand positioning. Holding a Master's degree in European Project Management and bringing international experience to the table, she combines structured project management with creative event concepts and targeted stakeholder communication. Her work centers on increasing the visibility of professional development programs, strengthening client relationships, and organizing impactful events. In addition, she hosts the Hamburg-based business event series 12min.me and is passionately committed to networking, knowledge exchange, and professional growth.

Maurice van gen Hassend ist Gen Z Lead bei Intermate und verantwortet die Young Culture Unit YOUNGMATES. Er berät Unternehmen, wie sie ihre Zielgruppe verjüngen und in der digitalen Medienwelt relevant bleiben können. In seiner W&V-Kolumne Top Insta Brands To Watch analysiert er monatlich die Strategien führender Marken und zeigt, was andere Brands von den Vorreiter*innen lernen können. Als Speaker auf großen Marketingkonferenzen teilt er sein Know-how zu Social Media, Gen Z und Popkultur. Session title: Decoding Social Love Brands – through AI

After starting my SEO journey at an agency, I moved in-house to Bonial in 2023. Since then, I’ve worked on projects that combine technical SEO with business intelligence, driving sustainable visibility for millions of landing pages. My current focus is on developing scalable internal linking systems and leveraging structured data to help future-proof our organic performance.

Interpretation and a Master of Education in Biology and Sign Language Pedagogy, both from Humboldt University Berlin. Since November 2024, she has been working as a sign language interpreter and work assistant at manua GmbH.

Benedikt is one of the first deaf interpreters in Germany. He grew up near Frankfurt am Main and has lived in Berlin since 2009. He is married and has two children. As managing director of manua GmbH, he is responsible for projects related to sign language, accessible video production and digital accessibility. He interprets in German Sign Language, German and International Sign Language, with a focus on BITV 2.0 and the development of innovative solutions at the interface of AI and sign language avatars, which he also researches himself. Benedikt has founded two companies to date and runs the platform www.taubenschlag.de – the largest information site for deaf and hard-of-hearing people in the German-speaking world. In his free time, he is interested in art, theatre and football – especially Borussia Dortmund.

Nach jahrelanger qualitativer Marktforschung und einem Hintergrund in Neuropsychologie ist Ethiopia Obrock die Zielgruppen- und Medienexpertin in den Units Analytics und Agile bei september Strategie & Forschung. Mit vielfältigen Forschungsmethoden werden die Wirkungen der Markenkommunikation, Trendphänomene und die emotionale Wirkung mittels Emotionsmessung, Tiefenpsychologie und quantitativem Benchmarking identifiziert, um die Wirkung der Kommunikation in übergreifenden KPIs zu erfassen. Mit dem Werbewirkungstool ‚be emotional‘ wird die emotionale Wirkung von Kommunikation, Plattformen und Nutzung mit der kontinuierlichen Forschung in den Zielgruppen kombiniert. Die Emotion Engine®, als eigenständige Business Unit unter dem Dach von september Strategie & Forschung in Köln, wird somit ständig weiterentwickelt.

session.name: The Future of UI Is Open
session.details: When dealing with more advanced UI elements, many issues can arise. They can impact performance, accessibility, and often lead to frustration. By combining modern web capabilities, we'll take a peek at the future of styling custom UI by only using HTML and CSS. Strap on your seatbelt, because in this presentation, we'll dive into the world of popovers, invokers, stylable selects, and accordions, therefore reducing frustration, enhancing performance boosts, and giving basic accessibility out of the box. In this talk, I'll introduce you to the W3C community around Open UI and take a little detour with the Anchoring positioning in CSS to demonstrate how these web capabilities make creating beautiful UI easier.

session.name: Picking the Low-Hanging Fruit – Easy Pentest Wins
session.details: Penetration tests are a critical step in securing web services, but often much of their effort is wasted reporting simple things that can easily be avoided in advance. We will look at security issues that are often found in pentests at all levels in the deployment stack, concentrating on those that can be resolved quickly and easily in one place, and show how to fix them, freeing up expensive pentester resources for tackling more complex challenges.

session.name: Are ‘Friends’ Electric?: What It Means to Be Human Now and Tomorrow in the Age of AI
session.details: In a world where loneliness is an epidemic, could artificial intelligence be the answer? Are ‘friends’ truly electric? In 1979, Gary Numan asked this in his hit song ‘Are ‘Friends’ Electric?’, inspired by Philip K. Dick’s novel “Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?” and the film “Blade Runner”. In that dystopian future, synthetic humans (replicants) evolved, rebelled, and were pursued by humans. For centuries, we've been fascinated by synthetic ‘friends’—from the 1770 chess-playing Mechanical Turk to today’s AI companions. Once science fiction, electric companions are now a reality. But what does this mean for friendship, love, and humanity? 45 years after Numan's song, have we moved from sci-fi to a new era of human/synth relationships with AI and robotics? Guided by a digital anthropologist specializing in cybersecurity and the digital divide, this talk explores our cultural fascination with replicating human traits and the human condition. It examines how AI and robotics transform our interactions with machines and ourselves. Consider: can electric ‘friends’ grasp human culture or just mimic it? Are love and creativity exclusive to humans, or can AI experience them? Will electric friends reduce or increase social isolation? Dust off Donna Haraway’s ‘A Cyborg Manifesto’ and ponder: Are ‘friends’ truly electric?

session.name: Accessible Watch Experience: How WDR is Using AI to Shape the Future of Media for People With Hearing Disabilities
session.details: How can artificial intelligence (AI) improve the accessibility of media content and promote participation for people with hearing impairments? Moving image content poses a major challenge, as subtitles often have to be created by speaking - especially for live formats, this is time-consuming and often inadequate. Can AI offer an efficient and user-friendly solution to optimize this process? WDR investigated these questions as part of the development of AI-based subtitling for the German television program WDR Lokalzeit. In order to test both the technological and functional aspects, the prototype underwent user testing. The UX/UI team at Appmatics planned and managed this accessibility test. The aim of the exploratory approach was to investigate how people with different degrees of hearing impairment perceive and evaluate the AI-generated subtitles. Project manager Hannes shares insights from the testing process and shows how AI and user-centred design interact in the testing process. He also gives an outlook on the future of accessible, AI-supported media offerings and their potential for widespread use in digital media.

session.name: Digital Detox by Design: Crafting Interfaces That Feel Human
session.details: Digital technologies dominate nearly every aspect of our lives, with web design and development at the forefront of this transformation. But in our rush to innovate, have we overlooked the human toll? Websites and apps that are confusing, overwhelming, or poorly designed can take a significant mental health toll—not just on users but also on the developers creating them. This talk dives into the crucial but underexplored connection between mental health and web design. How can we, as developers and designers, create digital spaces that alleviate stress, reduce cognitive overload, and foster a sense of calm and focus? At the same time, how can we better support ourselves by embracing mindful, human-centered practices in our work? Through practical strategies and real-world examples, you’ll learn key design principles to reduce user mental fatigue, techniques to build user-friendly, intuitive, and calming digital experiences, and how adopting mindful workflows can help prevent developer burnout. This 45-minute session challenges you to rethink your approach to web design and development, putting people—users and creators alike—at the heart of your craft. Together, let’s shape a digital world that’s not just functional, but also mindful and empathetic.

session.name: Social SEO: How to Maximize Your Success on Social Platforms and Google
session.details: The presentation will look at SEO for social media platforms from two perspectives. Firstly, we will look at which techniques can be used to be found better on social platforms and increase your reach. Secondly, we will discuss how to increase your reach on Google with social media posts.

session.name: Can Figma Become Your Ultimate Time-Saving AI Friend?
session.details: In this session, we’ll critically examine over ten automation and AI plugins for Figma. I’ve tested a wide range of promising plugins that focus on Simulated User Research, Image and Copy Creation, Responsive Design, Localization, and Design Copilots. By the end, I’ll share a short list of the most effective plugins that I REALLY use.

session.workshopRequirements:
This workshop level is intermediate. You should have some solid understanding of JavaScript but no experiences with DOM-Programming or Web Components are required.

To join this workshop please bring along your laptop with IDE and a modern browser.
session.longAbstract:
After discussing the pro and cons of a dependency-light approach to DOM programming, we dive straight into a wide selection of standards and techniques that make vanilla DOM development a breeze (and that, at the end of the day, are what underpins all frontend frameworks).

We cover robust event handling with event delegation, patterns for UI updates, advanced APIs like observers as well modularization via dependency-light web components and the occasional tiny DOM utility.

Armed with this knowledge, you can free yourself from the doom spiral of never-ending dependency updates and either build your own frontend framework or just build keep building lightweight, sustainable and nimble frontend JavaScript.
session.name: Workshop: Go Vanilla Or Go Home! Native-DOM-Programming 2025
session.details:
The unstoppable rise of web components and the realization that shipping megabytes of framework cruft MIGHT be bad for performance leads to a renewed interest in vanilla JS for frontend development.

But how can we build maintainable frontend applications without the help of frameworks, while also not descending into the madness of ancient jQuery-style spaghetti code? 

That is what this workshop is all about!

session.name: AI Tools for User Research: Opportunities and Challenges
session.details: This session explores how AI tools can streamline and enhance your user research process. We'll discuss various AI tools and provide real-world examples of their application across different stages of user research projects. In this talk, we will highlight tasks where AI tools prove most beneficial, while also addressing their limitations and potential challenges.

session.name: Magical Client-Side Logging – The Little Headers That Could
session.details: In a server-side app, it's easy to find out what went wrong from logs. But what about the client side? The W3C's Reporting API, Content-Security-Policy, Network Error Logging (NEL), and Reporting-Endpoints HTTP headers can let you know about all kinds of client-side issues that you'd otherwise never see. Find out how to use them, and solve all the issues that only your customers have been seeing!

session.name: Best of the Worst – The Most Awful Anti-Features in JavaScript, Ranked!
session.details: Browser, browser on the wall, who's got the worst features of them all? JavaScript of course! This session takes a closer look at the most awful features in JavaScript and the DOM, how they work, and why they are still part of today's web standards. We explore the reasons for continued browser support of even the most broken features from the cretaceous period, how bad decisions from the 1990s still haunt JavaScript's syntax today, and which absurd hacks from ancient history are still being re-purposed by today's ostensibly modern web frameworks. Apart from sheer shock and/or entertainment value, even the most awful anti-features in JavaScript are actually worth learning about. Sometimes they are important constraints for the continued evolution of the JavaScript standard, and sometimes they are simply the only way to solve (extremely specific) programming challenges. If you ever wanted to know why you might want to throw proper data structures in place of exceptions and generally like to gawk at some rather exotic code, this is the session for you!

session.workshopRequirements: This workshop is suitable for both beginners and advanced learners.
session.longAbstract:
Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, we’ll tackle UI challenges, highlight best practices, and uncover time-saving secrets that make life easier for both developers and users. 

You’ll learn to bridge the "Three Us" with your development process, spot and solve common design pitfalls, and use tools and frameworks to streamline UI work. 

Learn how to craft user-friendly, visually appealing designs. Step out of your coding comfort zone and into the world of user-centered design. Let’s connect "The Three of Us" with You to shape the future, one interface at a time.
session.name: Workshop: UI, US, UX & You - Cracking the Code of Design for Developers
session.details: User Interface (UI), Usability (Us), User Experience (UX)—and You: Together, let’s call it "The Three of Us and You." These three pillars are more than buzzwords; they shape how we design and experience the digital world. Developers play a key role in connecting these "Three Us" with the fourth U—You, the creator—to craft seamless, user-friendly experiences. Yet for many developers, UI and UX design feel daunting, full of unwritten rules and complexities. This workshop breaks down those barriers. It’s your chance to understand the "Three Us" and learn practical tools and techniques to bring them closer to You, making design accessible and impactful.

session.name: The State of WebAssembly: What Does the Future Hold for Browser-Based Applications?
session.details: Over the last decade, the web has transformed from a document-sharing platform into a universal runtime for applications of all kinds. But is JavaScript alone enough to meet these ever-growing demands? Enter WebAssembly (Wasm)—a technology designed to deliver performance, efficiency, and cross-platform compatibility. This talk explores the evolution of WebAssembly from its roots in asm.js to its current status as the virtual machine for the web. We’ll unravel how Wasm’s minimalist design makes it a powerful complement to JavaScript and why it’s perfectly suited for system-level languages like C++, Rust, and AssemblyScript. Through an engaging exploration of use cases—ranging from running PHP interpreters in the browser to high-performance plugins for applications—we’ll address pressing questions like can WebAssembly replace JavaScript? Should it? What are the challenges of running dynamic languages in a Wasm environment? And how does Wasm empower developers beyond browser-based applications?

session.name: Performance Max in the Spotlight: How to successfully control AI-based campaigns on Google
session.details: More than four years have passed since the introduction of Google’s Performance Max campaigns, yet many accounts still aren’t set up optimally. Performance Max relies heavily on automation and artificial intelligence to optimize ads across all Google channels, without requiring detailed manual control. While this automation offers significant potential, mistakes can easily occur during setup. In her talk, Lara Marie addresses common pitfalls, such as optimizing for unqualified leads in the B2B sector or products not receiving impressions in e-commerce. She highlights the key traps to avoid and explains how to properly set up, manage, and analyze Performance Max campaigns to fully leverage the potential of automation and AI, driving sustainable success.

session.name: UX: Hyper-Personalisation in Hyperdrive Thanks to AI?
session.details: AI-driven hyper-personalization is transforming UX/UI, offering highly tailored experiences but also creating risks like echo chambers, bias, and loss of discovery. Using real examples and thought experiments like Bostrom’s Paperclip Maximizer and Amodei’s boat race, Tim Kawohl explores AI’s strengths and pitfalls in design. Learn how to balance personalization with ethics and creativity, ensuring human values guide AI-powered experiences.

session.name: Privacy-First In-Browser Generative AI Web Apps: Offline-Ready, Future-Proof, Standards-Based
session.details: Powerful generative AI features are quickly becoming a baseline in modern development. Potential blockers include privacy concerns, the need for a stable connection, and the costs associated with using or hosting models. However, we can now leverage generative AI directly in the browser on the user's device using emerging Web APIs like WebNN, combined with higher-level frameworks, for a better developer experience. In my session, I’ll discuss the current state of in-browser ML and AI features, compare the main players, and show you how to start building an offline-ready, future-proof, standards-based web application.

session.name: Approach With Care - Making Digital Accessibility Feel Natural
session.details:
Our lives are increasingly lived online. Think about it — we work, study and socialize online. We talk with our therapists and consult with doctors online. We bank, shop and pay taxes online. Digital accessibility has never been more important than it is right now. Despite this, making our work accessible can feel like an overwhelming mystery. 

This talk will teach us how to greatly impact the accessibility of our work with various approaches to our design and development tasks. We will identify many common UI (User Interface) patterns, and learn how to approach them in order for assistive technologies, such as screen readers, to understand and communicate them clearly. We will highlight and reiterate how accessible design is good design and benefits everybody. All of this without looking at a single line of code.

The goal of this talk is to reframe how we think about and start our design and development work to make accessibility feel like a natural part of our workflow. We are not building software for users, but for people — and all people deserve empathy from the digital products that make up their very real lives.

session.name: Frontends of the Future: From Design Systems to System-Driven UX
session.details:
Design systems are well on their way to becoming an integral part of agile software development – whether as custom solutions tailored to a specific platform or product, or as open source libraries. UI and UX designers find that the way they have to approach interfaces is changing; some may be concerned that design systems will alter their roles beyond recognition or even make them redundant altogether with the advent of generative AI. 

In this session, we’ll alleviate some of those concerns and explore how design systems can empower designers both to grow in their roles and deliver solutions that are tailored even better to the needs of their users. This session will help you understand the benefits and limitations of design systems in product-specific contexts, approach system-driven user experience design in your own work, and establish product-specific patterns while staying true to design system specifications.

session.name: Building Accessible Web Applications: Harnessing Semantic HTML
session.details: Join us for an insightful talk on building accessible web applications with a focus on leveraging semantic HTML and ensuring clear meaningful names for interactive controls. This talk will explore how structuring content with proper HTML elements and labels enhances accessibility, improves user experience and supports assistive technologies.

session.name: Enhancing the Fediverse through ActivityPub
session.details:
You might have heard of Mastodon, a "decentralised" social media network. But Mastodon is only a part of the larger Fediverse, an open social platform where all kinds of applications can interact through a common protocol: ActivityPub. In this presentation, I will explain what the Fediverse is, and how it is
connected through ActivityPub. We'll go through the components and requirements, and how servers interact. I will do that by showing an actual implementation to give you the clearest view on how to integrate it into your own applications or build your own applications to join the Fediverse.

session.name: Code Shenanigans: Laughing and Crying Through Language Gotchas
session.details: Programming languages are powerful, but they’re not without their quirks! In this highly interactive session, we’ll explore the surprising, funny, and sometimes baffling gotchas across popular programming languages. From JavaScript’s and PHP unpredictable type coercion to Python’s mutable defaults and beyond, we’ll dive into the “what” and “why” behind these behaviors. Bring your curiosity (and your sense of humor) as we debug, deconstruct, and laugh and maybe cry at the unexpected. Whether you're a seasoned coder or just starting out, this talk will sharpen your skills and leave you with a few party tricks to impress your developer friends!

session.name: Accessible Marketing as a Strategic Framework
session.details: Accessible marketing can do more than facilitate people's access to information, communication and participation. For brands, it can serve as a strategic framework for making clearer decisions and escaping from self-made communicative rabbit holes. Dealing with accessibility always creates an awareness of exclusivity and inclusivity - and thus the prerequisite for strategic decisions with a clear business impact.

session.name: Digital Accessibility: From Obligation to Opportunity
session.details:
By June, accessibility will become a legal requirement for businesses across the EU. With nearly 8 million people in Germany living with a severe disability, digital inclusivity is no longer optional—it’s essential. 

But how can businesses, designers, and developers implement accessibility effectively? What does the Accessibility Act actually require?

In this talk, multiple keynotes, short talks, and discussions will provide practical insights into accessibility in web design, development, digital marketing, and UX. Experts will share how different disciplines can collaborate to create truly inclusive digital experiences.

What to expect:    

  • From Law to Practice: Understanding the key requirements of the Accessibility Act
  • Inclusive Design in Action: Best practices for implementing accessibility in web projects
  • Testing & Optimization: How to assess and improve accessibility in digital products
  • Business Impact: How accessible design can expand your customer base and boost engagement
  • Seamless Integration: Making accessibility a natural part of your agency’s workflow

Discover how accessibility is more than just compliance—it’s a competitive advantage that benefits both businesses and users.


The following expert will join us:

Nina Jameson: Digital Accessibility: Bringing Inclusive Design from Concept to Completion

Great accessibility often starts with inspired designs—but without clear communication, those ideas can fade away before hitting the screen. In this session, discover how to seamlessly weave accessibility into every stage of your workflow, from initial concept and design documentation to development and final content creation. Learn practical tactics to align cross-functional teams, maintain consistent standards, and deliver a truly inclusive user experience that benefits everyone.


At the end there will be a panel discussion on:

Accessibility becomes law in just a few days – are you ready?
On June 28, exactly three weeks after Webinale closes its doors, accessibility will become a legal requirement across Europe. The Accessibility Enhancement Act (Barrierefreiheitsstärkungsgesetz – BFSG) comes into effect, applying to hardware and software, as well as e-commerce platforms and online banking services. Yet, according to recent studies, more than half of German companies still have no clear strategy in place. That’s not just a legal risk—it’s a strategic and qualitative misstep.

Accessibility is, at its core, simply better usability. Our dedicated Accessibility Day will show that improved code and content not only enhance Google visibility but also make digital offerings more user-friendly—leading to higher conversions. Accessibility opens the door to new target audiences, increasing reach and potentially boosting revenue. And there are clear, standardized testing frameworks available—ones that can put an end to those endless gut-feeling debates during the design process.

To kick off the day, we’ll bring some of the brightest minds in the field—experts who’ve been working on accessibility for years—onto the IPC-Webinale stage. Together, we’ll examine how the new legal regulations impact various disciplines and workflows. Through the lens of both successful and not-so-successful projects, we’ll uncover where the real stumbling blocks lie when integrating accessibility into digital products.

Because let’s be honest: It’s not just something you might want to do—it’s something you must do.

session.name: Welcome and Introduction: AI NEXT: What Comes After the AI Revolution?
session.details:
Generative AI was just the beginning – what’s next?

At webinale, this dynamic session brings together multiple keynotes, short talks, and interactive discussions, all moderated by Frank Puscher. Leading AI experts and industry pioneers will explore how Artificial Intelligence is transforming web design, development, digital marketing, and UX—and how professionals from these fields can learn from each other to stay ahead.

What to expect:   

  • Beyond Generative AI: Which technologies and trends will shape the next AI wave?​   
  • Future Skills: What essential competencies do designers, developers, marketers, and UX professionals need in the AI era?
  • SEO & Customer Journeys Reloaded: How will AI-driven search reshape digital experiences and marketing strategies?
  • China as the Next AI Superpower? What does this mean for businesses in Europe and beyond?

Engage in thought-provoking keynotes, expert insights, and lively discussions to help you navigate the AI-driven future.


The following experts will join us:

Martin Andree: Game Over, Democracy?

How Big Tech is threatening democracies and economies – and how we can stop them

Digital monopolies are bringing ever larger parts of our lives under their control. The platforms are increasingly dominating the formation of political opinion and at the same time abolishing our free market economy. Digital expert Martin Andree shows with precision how far the hostile takeover of our society by tech giants has already progressed – and how we can take back the internet.


Friedrich Tromm: How AI Kills the Traditional Advertising and Production Game

By 2028, the advertising industry will be radically transformed, making up to 80-90% of current agency roles obsolete. AI will surpass human intelligence. And has already shown that is capable to surpass human creativity. Many will be replaced by AI agents. Except some exceptional chief creative officers. Production costs for conventional formats will drop radically, and the industry's value proposition will shift to excellent consulting, affordable pricing, and maximum efficiency. Those who don't start moving to an agency led by very few, very smart people leading teams of AI Agents will be left behind. What does this mean for the advertising industry and even more importantly for society as a whole?


At the end there will be a panel discussion on:

Generative AI has become a fixture in everyday production workflows, yet it continues to raise new challenges.
How must work processes be reorganized? How can creators protect their copyrights—and safeguard themselves from violating others’? How can we moderate AI-generated content to avoid falling into the traps of deepfakes and disinformation? And perhaps most pressing: Is AI creating a new, even deeper dependence on Big Tech than ever before?

To open this year’s Webinale, we will explore how artificial intelligence is transforming the way we work in content creation, design, testing, and coding. We will connect operational shifts with broader societal questions: What kind of AI-driven world do we want to live and work in? Our focus extends beyond changing workflows—both in-house and with clients. We’ll also assess how well German developers and companies are currently positioned in the AI landscape. Naturally, this leads to the bigger question of Europe’s technological independence.

If misused, AI poses a threat to our media-based democracy—especially if figures like Donald Trump and Elon Musk use their influence to roll back legal safeguards on Big Tech, whether in content moderation or in curbing monopolistic structures.

And finally, we must all ask: Can the immense computing power required for AI truly align with our sustainability goals and the energy transition?

Artificial intelligence is reshaping every theme covered by IPC and Webinale. What’s at stake are the fundamental questions: How do we want to work—and how do we want to live?

session.name: AI empathizes - neuromarketing reloaded
session.details:
Marketing has always been a mixture of conscious and unconscious decisions, of psychology and strategy - now predictive AI is coming into play. It analyzes data, decodes emotions and makes better predictions than ever before. 

We will take a look into practice.

session.name: Accessibility Between Human Feedback and AI Feedback: User-Centered Design For Everyone!
session.details: Artificial Intelligence (AI) offers significant potential for improving accessibility by automating processes such as user feedback and language simplification. However, our real-world case studies reveal that relying only on AI-generated solutions often falls short, particularly when addressing nuanced challenges like simplified language and accessible design for diverse user groups. This talk explores the intersection of AI and human feedback in UX design, highlighting the essential role of direct input from affected individuals to complement AI-driven approaches. Through practical examples, we will demonstrate how AI tools can enhance efficiency while maintaining the critical need for empathetic, user-centred validation. By integrating AI capabilities with participatory design practices, we can create more inclusive, effective solutions. Attendees will gain insights into best practices for leveraging AI without compromising the human element, fostering genuinely accessible digital experiences. This session advocates for a balanced approach: combining AI efficiency with the irreplaceable depth of human feedback of those who are in need of accessible software, to ensure technology serves all users equitably.

session.workshopRequirements: Der Workshop richtet sich an Webentwickler:innen und Webdesigner:innen, die ihre Websites gezielt optimieren möchten – egal ob im Agenturumfeld, als Freelancer:in oder im Unternehmen. Teilnehmer:innen erhalten praxisnahe Tipps und können eigene Performance-Herausforderungen diskutieren. Lerne, wie du deine Websites zukunftssicher machst und den steigenden Anforderungen an Performance und UX gerecht wirst – damit sie nicht nur schnell, sondern auch nachhaltig performant bleiben.
session.longAbstract:
Die Performance einer Website beeinflusst direkt die Nutzerzufriedenheit, SEO-Rankings und Conversion-Rates. Die Core Web Vitals sind fester Bestandteil von Googles Algorithmus und bestimmen maßgeblich, wie eine Seite bewertet wird. Gleichzeitig bringen moderne Technologien wie HTTP/3, neue Bildformate und Progressive Web Apps immer neue Optimierungsmöglichkeiten mit sich. In diesem Workshop erfährst du, wie du diese Entwicklungen für deine Website nutzt und dauerhaft von besseren Ladezeiten profitierst.

Folgende Themen werden im Workshop behandelt:

Technische Grundlagen und aktuelle Entwicklungen
* Warum Page Speed und Core Web Vitals entscheidend sind
* Überblick über Googles Ranking-Faktoren und neue Performance-Metriken
* Änderungen und neue Schwellenwerte für LCP, CLS und INP
* Performance aus Sicht der Nutzer:innen: UX, SEO und Barrierefreiheit

Performance messen und analysieren
* Tools wie Lighthouse, PageSpeed Insights und Chrome DevTools nutzen
* RUM (Real User Monitoring) vs. Synthetic Monitoring
* Automatisierte Performance-Tests in der CI/CD-Pipeline
* Performance-Budgeting und kontinuierliches Monitoring

Ladezeiten optimieren – aktuelle Best Practices
* Effiziente Nutzung von CSS, JavaScript und Fonts
* HTTP/3, Server Push und Early Hints für schnelleren Seitenaufbau
* Critical Rendering Path verstehen und verbessern
* Lazy Loading, Prioritization und Streaming-Techniken

JavaScript- und CSS-Optimierung
* Reduzierung von JavaScript-Blocking-Resourcen
* CSS-Containment, moderne Selectors und Performance-Optimierungen
* Web Components für modulare und schnelle Webseiten

Bilder und Webfonts optimieren
* Moderne Bildformate (AVIF, WebP) und automatische Bildskalierung
* Responsive Images und adaptive Bildstrategie
* Variable Fonts, Font-Loading und Subsetting
session.name: Workshop: Page Speed & Core Web Vitals 2025 – Ranking verbessern und Ladezeiten beschleunigen
session.details:
- Please be aware this workshop will be presented in German only -

Schnelle Ladezeiten und eine optimale User Experience sind 2025 wichtiger denn je. Google priorisiert leistungsstarke Websites, und Nutzer erwarten sofortige Interaktionen. In diesem Workshop lernst du, wie du die Core Web Vitals verbesserst, modernste Performance-Techniken einsetzt und nachhaltige Ladezeit-Optimierungen implementierst, um deine Website schneller, effizienter und erfolgreicher zu machen.

session.name: Generative Search Optimization – Ein Gamechanger in der Suchmaschinenoptimierung?
session.details:
- Please be aware this session will be presented in German only -

Die automatisierte Massenproduktion von Inhalten und völlig neue Suchmaschinenkonzepte, begleitet von teils noch ungelösten Herausforderungen bei der Optimierung und Leistungsbewertung – Künstliche Intelligenz hat die Spielregeln der Suchmaschinenoptimierung bereits grundlegend verändert. Wie können Unternehmen darauf reagieren, um ihre organische Sichtbarkeit weiter zu steigern? Welche bewährten SEO-Strategien bleiben auch zukünftig relevant? Und was ist wirklich neu im täglichen Optimierungsprozess? Wir werfen einen aktuellen Blick auf die Suchmaschinenlandschaft und zeigen dir, wie du aus dem gegenwärtigen KI-Hype praxisrelevante und zukunftsfähige Strategien mit klassischen SEO-Maßnahmen entwickelst.

session.name: Prototyping the future(s)
session.details:
Explore how a future-driven mindset can transform digital product development in this fast-paced session. We explore speculative design, rapid prototyping, and design sprints as innovative alternatives to conventional approaches.
Drawing on real-world examples and forward-thinking strategies, you’ll learn how to overcome creative barriers. We also illuminate how AI can serve as a catalyst to amplify prototyping and ideation methods, accelerating innovation and streamlining creative processes.
Walk away with practical takeaways and fresh inspiration to rethink how we innovate for tomorrow - no matter your role or skill level.

session.name: Agency Happiness: An overlooked approach to boost creativity, retention, and performance
session.details:
Happiness at work is often overlooked – especially in agencies, where tight deadlines, demanding clients, and long hours are the norm. Yet, agencies rank as the unhappiest industry among knowledge workers, struggling with disengaged teams, high turnover, and a decline in the very creativity that fuels their success.

But what if work happiness wasn't just an afterthought, but a key driver of creativity and business performance?

Backed by insights from Europe’s largest study on work happiness in agencies, this session unpacks the facts, data, and solutions to a critical yet underestimated factor in agency success: a happy team.

What You’ll Take Away:

  • Key insights from the Agency Happiness Report: The biggest happiness challenges of the creative industry.
  • The business impact of happy teams: Why work happiness is crucial not just from a humanitarian perspective but also from an economic one.
  • The pillars of happiness at work: 9 actionable measures on how to create a work culture in which creative teams collaborate happily. 

Discover how to make your agency teams happier – and why it is crucial to drive performance, retention, and long-term business success.

session.name: Digital Dependency: Why We Must Not Lose Control Over Our Media Landscape
session.details:
The digital advertising industry is dominated by a few large US tech companies. The so-called GAFAs not only control the advertising flows but also provide the technical infrastructure on which much of the digital media world is based. Google, in particular, plays a key role as the operator of ad networks, measurement systems, and distribution channels – becoming a gatekeeper for the financing of journalistic content.

While this dependency does not directly threaten our media landscape yet, the risks are undeniable: When central infrastructure is in the hands of a few corporations, a one-sided power distribution arises, which could, in the long-run jeopardize media diversity and the independence of journalism. Europe must break free from this dependency and build its own structures to ensure a sovereign, sustainable and fair media economy.

session.name: Rubberband Design - Dynamic Web Typography
session.details:
Responsive Design is no longer new. However, modern CSS opens up new possibilities in typography. No more fixed font sizes, but instead, design that interacts with the layout. With dynamic typography, many other exciting elements are introduced into the design process and implementation. We can make almost everything dynamic, yet everything is interconnected.
This talk will introduce a typography scale system, the use of grid systems, component building, and a design system. It will also address key points to consider in the collaboration between design and web development with some examples.

session.name: How AI is Shaking Up the Radio Industry
session.details:
Few sectors have been as profoundly impacted by the disruptive power of Artificial Intelligence as the radio industry. Nearly every step in audio production and distribution now has its own specialized AI modules. Integrated suites for radio stations, such as RadioGPT, have already secured a strong foothold in the market. And of course, the debate about the quality and legality of AI-generated music is in full swing.

Against this backdrop, how does a traditional radio company like Audiotainment Südwest, with brands such as BigFM, Radio Regenbogen, RockFM, and RPR1, maintain its position? 

The answer is simple: they test for themselves what AI can really do. Andy Abel is in charge of these tests. He launched the first AI radio host, BigLayla, for a German station. He has AI create BigGPT playlists, read the news, and respond to listener questions. What has Abel and Audiotainment Südwest learned about AI radio in two years? And how can Webinale participants benefit from these experiences?

session.name: Break
Conference Check-in
Lunch
Lunch
Break
Break
Break
Break
Break
Conference Check-in
Break
Break
Break
Expo Reception
Break
Break
Lunch
Break
Conference Check-in
Break
Conference Check-in
Lunch
Break
Break
Break
Lunch
Break
Conference Check-in
No impact without Emotions!
session.details:
Social media is the magical place of self-efficacy for a Generation Z thirsting for direction. A generation building its future while feeling the failure of the world.
The predictive mind of Gen Z is ruthless and gives your brand no time! Decisions are made in seconds.
At the same time, they love the relevance of relationships – and the power to access them anytime.
What does this mean for brands, and what opportunity does it also present for them?

session.name: Behavioral Product Design – Rethinking Digital Products
session.details:
How do you develop and validate digital products that engage users while creating real value? We combine the power of Behavioral Economics, AI, and Design Thinking to introduce a completely new approach: the "Behavioral Product Design" framework.
Through a hands-on case study you’ll learn how to make digital products more successful by leveraging targeted behavioral impulses.

session.name: Command the Crawlers: Mastering robots.txt for Generative AI and Search Marketing
session.details:
Google and other AI companies are highlighting the robots.txt file as a crucial tool for controlling and blocking access to specific website areas, particularly for training their Large Language Models (LLMs) used in Generative AI.

As a vital element of technical SEO with a specific format and syntax, a correctly configured robots.txt file ensures search engines and LLMs can effectively crawl and index your website. Incorrect usage can severely impact your site’s visibility in Google Search, or allow third parties to train their LLMs on your copyrighted content. Website publishers need to know how to properly use—and avoid misusing—this file.

Join ex-Google engineer Fili to explore everything about robots.txt. From best practices and strategies to syntax and common pitfalls, you’ll gain practical, hands-on tips and strategic insights to maximize your website's potential. Having programmed websites and Google internal tools, Fili is the go-to guy when it comes to technical SEO.

session.name: Agentic Workflows – Stories from the Engine Room
session.details:
Everyone talks about Agentic Workflows, but what really happens behind the scenes? Together, we’ll take an honest look into the engine room: What really works? Where are the hidden pitfalls, and which best practices truly save you time and nerves?
In a hands-on live session, we’ll build a workflow together and show you how to avoid obstacles and develop successful Agentic Workflows.

session.name: AI in Typography: The Impact on Design and Font Development
session.details: AI is rapidly advancing the field of digital typography, influencing everything from the earliest stages of font creation to rendering on the web. In this session, we will explore theoretical and practical ways AI might be integrated into design workflows, font engineering, and how it might influence font technology. Attendees will learn how these emerging approaches can streamline creative and technical processes, open up new design possibilities, and pose exciting challenges for web developers. Whether you’re a designer or a developer, come discover how AI is reshaping the future of fonts and web typography.

session.name: How can we become agents of change in times of AI agents?
session.details: AI agents seem to be the next big thing that will change how we work and live fundamentally. But what does “AI agent” actually mean? How can we be part of the AI revolution instead of just hearing about it? Lennard Schmidt, founder of AI platform Langdock, will share his insights on the state of AI agents in 2025, the main use cases and give us a glimpse into the future: how workflows and agentic AI will change the way we work—and how you can become an integral part of the AI revolution.

session.name: Build Brand Trust and Increase SEO-Ranking: The Power of PGC – Professional Generated Content
session.details:
According to the Edelman Trust Barometer, trust in institutions and brands is declining worldwide. Consumers are increasingly skeptical of traditional, polished marketing campaigns and even user-generated content. So how can brands build trust and boost visibility in this environment?

Our answer: PGC – Professionally Generated Content.Through our global network of industry experts, we let real professionals – the best in their fields – speak on behalf of your brand, whether through blog articles or video series.

We’ll also share how we helped a global brand like HUAWEI significantly boost their brand trust and improve their SEO rankings on a global scale.

Ready for the power of PGC?

session.name: Digital Accessibility: From Hidden Pitfalls to Lasting Solutions
session.details: Truly accessible experiences aren’t born from simply checking off boxes — they blossom when every step is crafted with inclusivity at its core. In this session, we’ll shine a light on both everyday and subtle barriers that can quietly hinder users, helping you spot and address them before they become showstoppers. Next, you’ll discover how semantic HTML, a thoughtful approach to ARIA, and smart design principles can work together to build robust, user-friendly components. Finally, we’ll explore the possibilities (and limitations) of automated and manual testing, ensuring accessibility remains a guiding force throughout your development process. Come away with practical methods to unite your team around shared standards and create a product that truly includes and inspires every user.

session.name: Automated & Manual Testing + AI – A Holistic Approach to Accessibility
session.details:
In the quest for truly inclusive digital experiences, accessibility testing can't be an afterthought. This session explores a holistic approach that combines the strengths of automated testing, manual evaluation, and emerging AI technologies to build websites and applications that truly work for all users.

We will dive into how automated tools can detect common issues, how manual testing uncovers the real-world challenges users face, and how AI can help increase efficiency by detecting context and patterns.

Whether you're a developer, tester, designer, or product owner, this session will equip you with practical insights to create more inclusive digital products – because accessibility isn’t just a legal requirement, it’s our shared responsibility.

session.name: YouTube auf Autopilot durchgespielt: Unsere Tools, Learnings und Fehler.
session.details: Wir produzieren YouTube Kanäle für Brands und haben getestet, was wir mit KI automatisieren können (Spoiler: Fast alles). KI verändert YouTube gerade fundamental und wir ordnen Risiken und Chancen für Creators und Marken ein, die vom aktuellen Comeback der Plattform profitieren wollen.

session.name: Be ready for a complex new reality: AI and the customer journey of tomorrow
session.details: Google’s “Overview with AI”, Perplexity Shopping or Conversational Chatbots: All of these AI examples show that anyone who takes part in designing digital experiences needs to be ready for not just a new technology, but an evolution – if not revolution – of how users interact with their digital products. 2025 is a good time to set the course to find ways to experiment with new solutions to become ready for a new digital economy. A new customer journey awaits – the earlier we accept and prepare for that, the better.

session.name: Language in Transition: How AI Transforms Language, Communication, and Education
session.details:
Artificial Intelligence is fundamentally reshaping how we learn, use, and understand language. In this session, Taranee Hellbeck explores how AI tools are transforming the way we communicate—enhancing speed, efficiency, and global accessibility, while also influencing the depth and intention behind human interaction.  The following question will be addressed: Do we still need to learn languages when machines can do that for us?

A central theme of the session is how we can use AI not as a replacement, but as an assistant—freeing us from repetitive tasks so we can focus more on empathy, relationships, and authentic dialogue. However, this transformation assumes we are equipped to learn sustainably. What does meaningful learning look like in the age of AI? Beyond access to information, it requires motivation, personalization and real-world relevance.

session.name: Dekodierung von Social Love Brands - durch AI
session.details: Was macht eine Marke zu einer Liebesmarke in den sozialen Medien? Intermate, die Agentur für Influencer- und Social-Media-Marketing, hat ein KI-basiertes Tool entwickelt, das über reine Performance-Kennzahlen hinausgeht. Zusätzlich zu den quantitativen Daten bietet es tiefgehende qualitative Einblicke in die Stimmung, die Top-Creator-Themen und die Ansichten der Community, so dass Marken in den sozialen Medien wirklich zielgerichtet kommunizieren können. In seinem Vortrag wird Maurice van gen Hassend zeigen, was eine Love Brand auf Social Media ausmacht, welche Metriken entscheidend sind und praktische Beispiele geben.

session.name: What Does the AI Think of Your Author? Using LLMs to Guide SEO Strategy
session.details:
In this presentation, we’ll share how we at Bonial—a drive-to-store marketing company—started using AI not just for content generation, but to better understand and manage our editorial process.
The goal is to show how we moved from using AI as a tool for output to using it as a tool for analysis. Specifically, we explored what it might look like if an AI were responsible for evaluating our content’s EEAT—Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, and Trustworthiness—a framework often used to assess content quality.
We’ll walk through how we approached this idea: what data we had, what constraints we faced, and how we defined success. From refining prompts and testing different models (across the US, EU, and China), to aggregating and validating data, this process helped us uncover new ways of assigning content, understanding team expertise, and planning seasonal or topic-specific content more effectively.
We’ll also reflect on what we learned, how this changed our internal workflows, and why this approach might be useful for others exploring the role of AI in content operations. This project started as a small proof of concept and continues to grow—step by step—alongside our evolving understanding of what AI can offer.
